author: kemsus

text:
Yeah this part of the game I will always remember. I followed the stupid stars through the guide but never reached my goal and without the internets I got stuck forever...
Until now as I'm replaying the game. It make me kinda feel sad for the kid as he gets knocked down, caged, beaten up, stabbed with a sword, imprisoned, beaten up the third time, falling over a cliff, beaten up the 4th and got knocked out in the arena.
I hate Sunder and his bro. The most annoying bad guys in a game ever.

author: Siquall77

text: These are really entertaining games.  I think they are a bit of an acquired taste, though.  There are usually some things about BoF games that I immediately don't like.  But once I play for awhile, it's easy to ignore the things I don't like about the games.  Breath of Fire III is a pretty good game.

text:

Now getting all of the secret items hidden in the desert of death, screw that.

text: The guy that first gives you directions says something different from the note that he actually gives you.  I think the directions on the note were wrong.  Good thing I used the old pen and paper when I talked to the npc the first time.

author: TurnipsAge

text: Yesterday's upload made me think of the Desert of Death. This theme is engraved in my head, I got stuck in there for at least a week trying to figure out where to go. Now I don't know if it's just because I was a kid when I played this game and I didn't pay attention or if this happened to a lot of other people, but that made for a memorable experience. Frustrating when playing after a week, but memorable in the long run.
author: SupraDarky
